lru-type.name: SAS
lru-type.description: Photonic Subarray Switch LRU is the device that selects which Subarray each of the ALMA antennas will reside in.

assembly-type.name: SAS
assembly-type.description: Photonic Subarray Switch LRU is the device that selects which Subarray each of the ALMA antennas will reside in.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides the status of the automated firmware routines.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point provides the status of the automated firmware routines.

baci-property.description: Indicates whether the PC1(PBS) needs to be optimized and recalls the last peak power level recorded from the PBS optical detector (PD1). Upon boot up, byte 0 will return 1, indicating an optimization is needed. After the optimization algorithm has run successfully, byte 0 returns 0. If the power level at the corresponding photo detector drops by 20%, byte 0 returns 1 until the power level has increased above the threshold or another optimization algorithm has run successfully.

monitor-point.description: Indicates whether the PC1(PBS) needs to be optimized and recalls the last peak power level recorded from the PBS optical detector (PD1). Upon boot up, byte 0 will return 1, indicating an optimization is needed. After the optimization algorithm has run successfully, byte 0 returns 0. If the power level at the corresponding photo detector drops by 20%, byte 0 returns 1 until the power level has increased above the threshold or another optimization algorithm has run successfully.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides whether the PBS polarization controller needs to be optimized. Bit 0: 1 = Optimization needed. 0 = Optimization not needed.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point provides whether the PBS polarization controller needs to be optimized. Bit 0: 1 = Optimization needed. 0 = Optimization not needed.

baci-property.description: This monitor point recalls the last peak power level recorded from the PBS optical detector (PD1).

monitor-point.description: This monitor point recalls the last peak power level recorded from the PBS optical detector (PD1).

baci-property.description: Indicates whether PC2 (ML_REF) needs to be optimized and recalls the last peak power level recorded from the beatnote optical detector (PD3). Upon boot up, byte 0 will return 1, indicating an optimization is needed. After the optimization algorithm has run successfully, byte 0 returns 0. If the power level at the corresponding photo detector drops by 20%, byte 0 returns 1 until the power level has increased above the threshold or another optimization algorithm has run successfully.

monitor-point.description: Indicates whether PC2 (ML_REF) needs to be optimized and recalls the last peak power level recorded from the beatnote optical detector (PD3). Upon boot up, byte 0 will return 1, indicating an optimization is needed. After the optimization algorithm has run successfully, byte 0 returns 0. If the power level at the corresponding photo detector drops by 20%, byte 0 returns 1 until the power level has increased above the threshold or another optimization algorithm has run successfully.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides whether polarization controller 2 (ML_REF) needs to be optimized. Bit 0: 1 = Optimization needed. 0 = Optimization not needed.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point provides whether polarization controller 2 (ML_REF) needs to be optimized. Bit 0: 1 = Optimization needed. 0 = Optimization not needed.

baci-property.description: This monitor point recalls the last peak power level recorded from the beatnote optical detector (PD2).

monitor-point.description: This monitor point recalls the last peak power level recorded from the beatnote optical detector (PD2).

baci-property.description: Retrieves a byte from the FRAM buffer. Reading a value from the FRAM is a two step process. The command READ_FRAM must be written to load the byte from a memory location into a buffer. This monitor point then reads the value stored in the buffer.

monitor-point.description: Retrieves a byte from the FRAM buffer. Reading a value from the FRAM is a two step process. The command READ_FRAM must be written to load the byte from a memory location into a buffer. This monitor point then reads the value stored in the buffer.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides the 1st control voltage of the Polarization Controller #1 (PBS). (The polarization controllers have four independent voltage settings)

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides polarization controller #1 (PBS) temperature.

baci-property.description: Gets the PBS optical detector (PD1) power. This is a measure the total power of the 1st LO reference lightwave after transmission through the polarizing beamsplitter

monitor-point.description: Gets the PBS optical detector (PD1) power. This is a measure the total power of the 1st LO reference lightwave after transmission through the polarizing beamsplitter

baci-property.description: Gets beatnote optical detector (PD3) power level. This is a measure the total power of the 50 MHz signal generated by the reference and round-trip return lightwave.

monitor-point.description: Gets beatnote optical detector (PD3) power level. This is a measure the total power of the 50 MHz signal generated by the reference and round-trip return lightwave.

baci-property.description: Gets return signal detector (PD2) power. This is a measure the total power of the 1st LO reference lightwave return signal that has been reflected from the Faraday rotator in the LPR.

monitor-point.description: Gets return signal detector (PD2) power. This is a measure the total power of the 1st LO reference lightwave return signal that has been reflected from the Faraday rotator in the LPR.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides the identification information for the module which includes the CIN, Serial Number and Hardware version.

baci-property.description: This monitor point provides the date and the Perforce (backend repository software) version of the firmware.
